page.title: 03The Valley Brook.
page.content: The Valley brook comes from Queen's Park lake and runs into the river Weaver. On one side there is a wood and on the other side there is wild grass with a few trees The bank is sand,and water voles burrow there. Lots of people go down the brook for walks,to watch wildlife and to take their dogs for walks. We have seen lots of wildlife down the brook this is some of it. FISH:minnow,stickle back. BIRDS:heron,kestrel,jay,goldfinch, gold crest,lesser spotted woodpecker,greater spotted woodpecker, magpie,wren,cuckoo,sparrow,kingfisher, starling,swift,swallow,woodpigeon. MAMMALS:water vole,mouse,brown rat. SNAKES:grass snake,adder.
